oai_dc:dc.dc:title: J. Moree discharge, 1838
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: A. Gregg
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: To All Whom It May Concern. Knox ye, That Josiah Moree, a private of Capt. Abraham Gregg's Company of East Tennessee Volunteer Infantry, was mustered into the service of the United States at Fort Cass, Tennessee, on the 2nd day of June, 1838, for three months, and having performed all the duties of a Soldier, is hereby honorably discharged. (Signed) A. Gregg, Capt. Commanding company. 1 pc. Fort Cass on the Hiwassee River was one of the 'removal' camps in Tennessee when the Cherokee Indians were moved to the West (Trail of Tears).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military personnel; Military discharges; Indigenous peoples;
